CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Violation of Art. 13;Remainder inadmissible;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in the village of GPE , GPE .
CARDINAL . According to the applicant , a number of third persons unlawfully occupied a part of her house .
CARDINAL . On DATE she filed a civil action with the GPE ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) in which she sought the eviction of a number of third persons .
CARDINAL . On DATE the statement of claim and supporting documents reached ORG .
CARDINAL . By decision of CARDINAL DATE ORG accepted the case for examination .
CARDINAL . It appears that a proper resolution of the dispute required questioning of a person living in the town of GPE . On DATE ORG made such request to ORG .
CARDINAL . According to the Government , the hearings in the case were suspended pending the response .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date ORG received the transcripts of the questioning of the witness .

CARDINAL . Having resumed the hearings in the case on DATE , by judgment of the same date ORG partly granted the applicant ’s claim and ordered the defendants not to prevent the applicant from using her house . The court rejected the claim insofar as the eviction was concerned .
CARDINAL . A copy of the judgment was served on the applicant on DATE . The applicant appealed against the judgment .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( “ the Regional Court ” ) accepted the applicant ’s appeal on the ground that ORG had failed to notify the applicant and her counsel of the hearing in the case and had taken decisions in their absence . ORG quashed the judgment of DATE and remitted the case for a fresh consideration at first instance .
CARDINAL . ORG returned the case - file to ORG on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the judge in charge of the case withdrew from the proceedings on the ground that she had already expressed an opinion on the merits of the dispute .
CARDINAL . By decision of CARDINAL DATE the Presidium of ORG quashed the withdrawal and on DATE returned the case to the first instance .
CARDINAL . Thereafter the proceedings were adjourned due to the judge ’s illness and the transfer of the case to another judge .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant amended her claims .
CARDINAL . The next hearing took place on DATE .
CARDINAL . On that date a prosecutor joined the case , acting for the applicant . The applicant and her counsel failed to attend that hearing .
CARDINAL . The hearings were postponed on DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE due to the defendants’ failure to attend .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG delivered a judgment in the case in which it dismissed the applicant ’s claims .
CARDINAL . It does not appear that the parties appealed against that judgment .
CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor , acting for the applicant , brought a supervisory review complaint against the judgment of DATE .
CARDINAL . The outcome of those proceedings is unclear .

CARDINAL . On several occasions , DATE , the applicant complained about the excessive length of the case to the prosecutors and higher courts , requesting them to speed up the proceedings and to bring criminal proceedings against the judge who sat in her case .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant received a letter from ORG in which the authority admitted unjustified delays in the proceedings . However , it rejected the applicant ’s requests .

CARDINAL . According to the Government , in DATE disciplinary proceedings were brought against the judge in charge of the case in ORG and by decision of DATE ORG dismissed her from the post for , among other things , excessive delays in the examination of the applicant ’s case .
